subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] From a VERY new enthusiast....
msgSnippet: Hi Erik, In addition to this group, there is a new group called read_alphabet_letters that was specifically formed in order for people to be able to exchange
messageBody:
Hi Erik,

In addition to this group, there is a new group called
"read_alphabet_letters" that was specifically formed in order for
people to be able to exchange hand-written QS letters. In that group,
we write by hand, scan the files and upload them. We take turns, with
one person submitting each week. You're quite welcome to join even if
you're just learning the Read alphabet.

Here's the group site:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/read_alphabet_letters/

Ted


On Nov 30, 2007 9:08 AM, Erik Felker <ejfelker@...> wrote:
>
>
>
>
>
>
> I am just getting my toes wet in Quickscript, which I find very
> interesting. I am especially interested at the moment in the fact
> that it is a writing system for English that allows people to write as
> they speak. In the USA, for example, we have regional accents that
> essentially disappear when we write English, but which are apparent
> when we speak/listen; Quickscript allows those differences to appear
> naturally in writing if they are desired. I can also see that
> Quickscript could be very useful to someone who is studying English as
> a foreign language.
>
> Now that I have said all that, I will get to the major reason for this
> message: I would like to connect with another person who is new to
> Quickscript so that we can exchange hand-written exercises in letter
> formation and word formation, struggling our way toward--gasp!--actual
> sentences. If you feel the same need for support and constructive
> criticism that I do, please contact me. (I live in California, USA,
> where we generally are seen/heard as not having a regional accent in
> comparison with some other areas of the country.)
>
> Happy communicating to all!
>
>

Hi Erik,

In addition to this group, there is a new group called
"read_alphabet_letters" that was specifically formed in order for
people to be able to exchange hand-written QS letters. In that group,
we write by hand, scan the files and upload them. We take turns, with
one person submitting each week. You're quite welcome to join even if
you're just learning the Read alphabet.

Here's the group site:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/read_alphabet_letters/

Ted
